We are located at 249 Buckley Road, Holtsville, N.Y. 11742 and our phone number is 631-758-9664 Parking Fees Parks Department parking sticker and parking fees apply May 1 - October 15. Hours of Operation The Town of Brookhaven Ecology Site will be open April 3rd and April 4th.

Welcome to the Town of Brookhaven, the largest town in Suffolk County and a great place to live, work and play. This website is your resource for Brookhaven Town government. Edward P. Romaine Nondiscrimination Public Notice.

Overview. Located mostly in the western part of the town of Brookhaven with a small portion in Islip, Holtsville makes an excellent place to live. The village is populated by about 20,000 inhabitants, who come to the area for the nice residential areas and convenient access to highways and the local businesses.

Holtsville History. Holtsville is a census-designated hamlet located in the Town of Islip. The area was originally inhabited by the Algonquian-speaking Native Americans and was first settled in by Europeans in the late 1600s. Holtsville was named after postmaster general Joseph Holt. Holtsville and nearby Attractions.
